briefTitle: Impact of Diabetes on Left Ventricular Remodeling
officialTitle: Phase 2/3 Study of Effect of AT1RB Versus ACE Inhibitor in Addition to XO Inhibitor on Progression of LV Remodeling and Dysfunction in Diabetic Patients With Acute MI.
summary: The investigators hypothesize that in patients with diabetes and acute myocardial infarction (MI), Ang II type-1 receptor blockade (AT1RB) attenuates left ventricle (LV) remodeling to a greater extent than angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor therapy and that the addition of xanthine oxidase (XO) inhibitor, Allopurinol, results in further improvement in LV remodeling and function in the follow-up phase after MI.

primaryOutcome.measure: Left Ventricular End Diastolic Volume Indexed to Body Surface Area (LVEDV/BSA)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 5 visits per Participant over 2 years (about every 6 months)
